title.narrative: CPD Institutional Strengthening to Support Bangladeshs Dual Transition

description.narrative:
The key result is ‘To ensure an inclusive and just society by addressing the pitfalls of Bangladesh’s dual graduation through research, policy dialogue and participatory outreach’. The indicators include: - Improvement in economic, social, environmental and governance indicators; - Institutional and regulatory reforms undertaken by Government of Bangladesh
Project objective To increase awareness among stakeholders including policymakers on the pitfalls of Bangladesh’s dual graduation and necessary changes in policies, measures and operations to be required addressing those through independent research and participatory discussions
Impact Indicator Awareness among policymakers, bureaucrats, private sector and other stakeholders on the necessary reforms in policies, operations and measures to be required for addressing the pitfalls of graduation
Baseline Year 2019 Policymakers bureaucrats, private sector and other stakeholders have limited awareness on the pitfalls of Bangladesh’s dual graduation
Target Year 2022 Increased awareness among policymakers bureaucrats, private sector and other stakeholders on the necessary reforms required for addressing the pitfalls of graduation
